Camera Class Reference
[Hierarchical graphics library]

#include <Camera.h>

Inheritance diagram for Camera:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Camera node in scene graph.

Camera contains point-of-view, field-of-view, viewport and other attributes that desribe how the scene is rendered. There can be multiple cameras in the scene.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Camera::Camera ( const Camera &  other  ) 

Copy by value.

New camera is unlinked.

Member Function Documentation

void Camera::cacheTransforms ( NS(gr, Context)*  context,
const NS(lang, Array)< Node * > &  nodes 
)

Caches camera transforms and all world transforms from the nodes.

Used in rendering. After this method, NS(Camera,getCachedTransform)() can be used to get valid world transform for any node in the array.

virtual Node* Camera::clone (  )  const [virtual]

Returns clone of this node.

Clones child nodes as well.

Reimplemented from Node.

void Camera::cullVisuals ( const NS(lang, Array)< Node * > &  nodes,
NS(lang, Array)< Visual * > &  visuals 
)

Collects all visible visuals from 'nodes' array to 'visuals' array and sorts them by ascending distance to camera.

Visuals are culled by bounding box before adding them to the array.

const ViewFrustum& Camera::frustum (  )  const [inline]

Returns current view frustum.

Used only if orthographic() is false.

void Camera::mirrorXAxis (  ) 

Mirrors local transform X-axis.

Used for platforms which can accept rendering only in right-handed coordinate system.

Camera::NS ( lang  ,
Array   
) const

Gets cached lights sorted by distance to world position.

Number of lights returned is limited to NS(Shader,MAX)_LIGHTS. This function can be used only during rendering.

const Camera::NS ( math  ,
float4x4   
) const

Returns view-projection transformation.

This function can be used only during rendering. Updated by calling cacheTransforms().

const Camera::NS ( math  ,
float3x4   
) const

Returns view (=world to camera) transformation.

This function can be used only during rendering. Updated by calling cacheTransforms().

Reimplemented from Node.

const Camera::NS ( math  ,
float3x4   
) const

Returns world (=camera to world) transformation.

This function can be used only during rendering. Updated by calling cacheTransforms().

Reimplemented from Node.

const Camera::NS ( math  ,
float3x4   
) const

Returns cached world transformation for the node.

This function can be used only during rendering. (Requires that the node has been in the scene graph when NS(Camera,cacheTransforms) was called AND that the scene graph hasn't been modified after since.)

Reimplemented from Node.

bool Camera::orthographicProjection (  )  const [inline]

Returns true if orthographic projection is enabled.

If this is enabled then all view coordinates are used directly as screen coordinates.

void Camera::setOrthographicProjection ( bool  enabled  ) 

Toggles orthographic projection.

If this is enabled then all view coordinates are used directly as screen coordinates.
